Question Text: Which of the following properties are characteristics of virtual networks (but not necessarily characteristics of SDN). Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Separates logical and physical networks.
b. Often deployed in data center networks to allow multiple tenants to share physical network infrastructure.
c. Separates the data and control plane.
d. Refactors network control so that network behavior is controlled from a single logically centralized controller.
e. Abstracts the details of the physical network.
LLM Explanation: Virtual networks have the following characteristics: a) They separate the logical network view from the underlying physical network infrastructure.  b) They are commonly used in data centers to enable multiple tenants or customers to share the same physical network hardware while maintaining isolated logical networks. e) They abstract away the details and complexity of the physical network from the logical network view. While SDN also separates the control and data planes (c) and centralizes network control logic (d), these are not inherent properties of all virtual networks.

Question Text: Which of the following are possible ways of creating virtual links in a virtual network? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. VLAN switching based on a VLAN tag.
b. A wide-area tunnel, whereby an Ethernet packet sent between two virtual machines is encapsulated in an IP packet.
c. Longest-prefix match forwarding on an IP router.
d. A wide-area tunnel, whereby an IP packet is encapsulated in an MPLS tunnel by attaching an MPLS header to the packet.
e. Pairs of virtual Ethernet interfaces, where one end of the Ethernet interface pair resides in the virtual environment, and the other resides in the root namespace on the host machine.
LLM Explanation: Virtual links in a virtual network can be created in several ways:a. VLAN switching based on VLAN tags allows creating separate virtual networks on the same physical infrastructure.  b. IP-in-IP tunneling encapsulates Ethernet frames between VMs in IP packets, enabling wide-area virtual links.d. MPLS tunneling encapsulates IP packets in MPLS tunnels, which can also create wide-area virtual links.e. Virtual Ethernet interface pairs, with one end in the virtual environment and the other in the host's root namespace, enable local virtual links.Longest-prefix match IP forwarding (c) is a regular IP routing mechanism, not specifically a way to create virtual links.
URLs: ['Foundations of Modern Networking: SDN, NFV, QoE, IoT, and Cloud by William Stallings (2015)', 'Software Defined Networks: A Comprehensive Approach by Paul Goransson and Chuck Black (2014)', 'Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach by James Kurose and Keith Ross (2016)']

Question Text: Which of the following are true of the Mininet network emulator? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Mininet only allows users to create three types of topologies: linear, tree, and single-switch topologies.
b. It requires running OpenFlow-capable switches.
c. It can create an emulation that runs across multiple physically distributed nodes.
d. All of the hosts in the topology must run the same underlying operating system.
e. It is difficult to use it to route traffic for real services.
LLM Explanation: Mininet is a flexible network emulator that allows creating various network topologies, not limited to just linear, tree, and single-switch (a is incorrect). It uses software-based OpenFlow switches by default, but can also connect to external OpenFlow switches if needed (b is incorrect). Mininet can create an emulation that spans multiple physical machines (c is correct). The emulated hosts can run different operating systems or software (d is incorrect). Mininet makes it easy to route real traffic through the emulated network for testing real services and applications (e is correct).

Question Text: What are the benefits of emulation as opposed to, say, simulation? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. An emulator makes it possible to "port" experiments from one machine to another.
b. An emulation will complete faster than a simulation.
c. Every run of the emulator will yield exactly the same results, resulting in reproducible experiments.
d. An emulator allows the experimenter run real software on each of the nodes in the emulation.
e. An emulation is easier to debug than a simulation.
LLM Explanation: The benefits of emulation over simulation are:a) An emulator allows porting experiments between machines. The emulator abstracts the underlying hardware, so the same emulation can run on different physical machines.  d) An emulator runs real software on each emulated node. This allows testing and experimentation with actual software implementations rather than just models.Emulation is not necessarily faster than simulation (b), may not always yield exactly the same results each run due to real-world factors (c), and is not necessarily easier to debug than a simulation (e).

Question Text: Which of the following are possible in Mininet? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Assigning custom IP addresses to each node in the topology.
b. Running performance measurement tools (e.g., iperf, wget) between nodes.
c. Assigning IP addresses to each node in the topology using a DHCP server.
d. Measuring the latency between a host in San Francisco and a host in Los Angeles.
e. "Shaping" a link between two nodes to a particular traffic rate.
LLM Explanation: In Mininet, it is possible to assign custom IP addresses to each node in the topology (a), run performance measurement tools like iperf and wget between nodes (b), and shape the link between two nodes to a particular traffic rate (e). Mininet does not have built-in DHCP server functionality to automatically assign IP addresses to nodes (c). While Mininet can emulate network topologies, it runs on a single machine, so measuring latency between geographically distant hosts is not feasible (d).

Question Text: Which of the following functions does FlowVisor enable? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Allowing two controllers to control traffic on distinct VLANs.
b. Allowing one controller to control TCP traffic and one controller to control UDP traffic.
c. Allowing two different researchers to implement and deploy different Web load balancing applications for port 80 traffic.
d. Allowing two different researchers to implement and deploy different load balancing applications for all traffic between the same source-destination pair.
e. Allowing two different researchers to implement and deploy control mechanisms for two distinct applications.
LLM Explanation: FlowVisor enables network virtualization by allowing multiple controllers to share the same physical infrastructure. It can slice the network based on various criteria such as VLANs (a), transport protocols like TCP/UDP (b), and distinct applications (e). However, it cannot slice the network for the same traffic type, such as port 80 traffic (c) or traffic between the same source-destination pair (d), and allow different controllers to manage them separately.

Question Text: Which of the following are stated applications of the Nicira Network Virtualization Platform? Select all that apply.
Choices:
a. Dynamic workload placement in multi-tenant data centers.
b. Central management of security policies.
c. Creating more than 1024 virtual networks, as opposed to the alternative of using VLAN tags.
d. Allowing experimental protocols to coincide with a production network.
e. Easier transition to IPv6 in data-center networks.
LLM Explanation: The Nicira Network Virtualization Platform enables several applications, including: a) Dynamic workload placement in multi-tenant data centers by abstracting network services from the underlying hardware. b) Central management of security policies across the entire network. c) Creating more than 4096 isolated virtual networks, surpassing the 4094 VLAN limit. d) Allowing experimental protocols to run alongside production traffic on the same physical network by isolating them. The platform does not specifically aim to ease IPv6 transition in data centers.
URLs: ['Koponen, Teemu, et al. "Network Virtualization in Multi-tenant Datacenters." 11th USENIX Symposium on Networked Systems Design and Implementation (NSDI 14). 2014.', 'Casado, Martin, et al. "Virtualizing the network forwarding plane." Proceedings of the 2010 ACM CoNEXT Student Workshop. 2010.']

Question Text: Select the statement that is most true about the relationship between network virtualization and SDNs.
Choices:
a. Network virtualization and software-defined networking each enable the other: SDN cannot exist without network virtualization, and network virtualization cannot exist without SDN.
b. Network virtualization is a potential enabler for software-defined networks, since the separation of data and control planes first requires the creation of a logical network.
c. Software-defined networking is a potential enabler for virtual networks, since separation of data and control planes makes it easier to manage a logical network topology.
d. Network virtualization is a new concept introduced by Amazon, Nicira, and industry players; it only made sense to talk about network virtualization once central SDN controllers existed.
LLM Explanation: Software-defined networking (SDN) is a potential enabler for virtual networks. The separation of the data plane and control plane in SDN makes it easier to manage a logical network topology independent of the underlying physical infrastructure. SDN provides the flexibility and programmability to create, configure, and manage virtual networks on top of a shared physical network. While network virtualization can exist without SDN, SDN makes implementing and orchestrating virtual networks more efficient and scalable.
